result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin M Arellano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy money are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Buy money to be paid to Metro Drug Unit withing the first year of probation.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Work towards obtaining GED or HSED.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees, no new criminal law violations and complete the course work for high school diploma, GED or HSED.  If the agent imposes any of the condition time, the court will not grant the expunction.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to contact probation (Dept. of Corrections) by 09:00 a.m. on 10-06-2016.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colin M Arellano in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  2 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1 Year.
Extended Supervision: 1 Year.
116 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

Any outstanding costs/fines are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colin M Arellano in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant completed the application for court appointed attorney.  Court asks defendant if he is given addtional time can he obtain a private attorney.  Defendant states that he might, but is asking the court to take into consideration the application for court appointed attorney today instead.  Court reviews the application in court.  Court grants the application for court appointed attorney.  Court will order repayment at $100.00/month effective 05/16/2016 and reoccuring monthly payments on the 15th of every month thereafter.  Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
